results.title: The Desert hopping mouse
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Web of life”.
Focuses on the spinifex hopping mouse of inland Australia to illustrate the many features it possesses which enable it to survive in what appears to be an extremely hostile environment. Also shows its daily activities, its methods of reproduction and the ways in which these may change with the seasons or from year to year. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: The Living lakes
results.creator_credit: Richard Brock, British Petroleum and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Web of life”.
A study of the ecology of the lakes which form a part of the Great Rift Valley in Kenya. Each lake in this dramatic valley has its own “web of life” with each species adapted to the local conditions. Among the string of lakes examined there is great contrast, ranging from the 150 degree fahrenheight soda flats of Lake Magadi to the clear waters of Lake Naivasha with its abundance of pink lilies.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Brock, British Petroleum and British Broadcasting Corporation

results.title: The Living river
results.creator_credit: Richard Brock, British Petroleum and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Web of life”.
Thoughtless actions by humans can easily upset the delicately adjusted balance of life in a river. Shows how the seasons, weather, flora and fauna of the River Test are all integrated and woven into a “web of life”. Includes underwater shots of birds feeding from the river bed and thousands of eels on migration.

results.title: Lifetimes of change: development and growth
results.creator_credit: Australian Academy of Science and Educational Media International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Web of life”.
Shows the changes that take place within the lifetimes of individual organisms. Illustrates the ideas of birth, growth, change and decay by using three examples from the natural world: toadstools, frogs and flowering plants. Also notes the main changes in structure and in behaviour that distinguish a human lifetime. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Academy of Science and Educational Media International

results.title: Boys in the age of machines
results.creator_credit: Giorgio Mangiamele, Ronald Mason and Academy Film Productions
results.brief_description: Presents the many opportunities available today in the field of engineering. Shows a typical machine-shop where a young apprentice follows the production of a pattern from the drawing board design to the casting being finished in the dressing shop. Outlines various diploma and degree courses; employment opportunities based on educational qualifications; preliminary subjects required in basic education.

results.title: Careers in science and technology
results.creator_credit: Bruce McNaughton, Ronald Mason and Academy Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Way to Tomorrow”.
Explains the scope of employment in scientific and technical fields in Australia. Shows many examples of work in laboratories and workshops and out of doors, covering research and application in physical and biological sciences, meteorology, geology, engineering, instrumentation and automation, power generation, food industries etc. Gives guidance on the prerequisites necessary to enter the fields.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bruce McNaughton, Ronald Mason and Academy Film Productions

results.title: It's an outdoor world
results.creator_credit: Dennis Trewin, Ronald Mason and Academy Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Way to Tomorrow”.
Made to give a balanced view of typical occupations where the work is largely out of doors, showing the relation of field work to administrative and clerical elements and the kind of opportunities that are open for young people interested in outdoor work. Cast includes Norman Kaye and John Derum.

results.title: Careers in building
results.creator_credit: Bruce McNaughton, Ronald Mason and Academy Film Productions
results.brief_description: A vocational guidance film on the building industry. Shows the erection of a tall city office block; the men and women of the building industry at work in their diverse activities; the craftsmanship and skill required to erect a typical Australian brick veneer home; the development of a new airline terminal; and the construction work involved in a guided missile rocket pad.
